title: CTRL0000060761 - Transcribed Interview of John Douglas Wright, (Mar. 31, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The interview in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 2:07 p.m.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
We'll go on the record at 2:07 p.m. Eastern Time.
This is a transcribed interview of Mr. John Douglas Wright
conducted by the House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the
United States Capitol pursuant to House Resolution 503.
At this time, I'd ask the witness to please state your full name and spell your last
So this will be a staff-led interview, and members, of course, may also choose to
However, there are no congressional members present at this time.
In the room today, we have
, who's me, I ' m _ , I'm an
And we h a v e -
As I just stated, there are no members present.
At this time, could counsel please state their name for the record?
Attorney Noah Christian Munyer, Akron, Ohio, Ohio bar lawyer,
Federal lawyer in Northern District and District of Columbia, 0086575.
There is an official reporter transcribing the record of this interview today, so
please wait until each question is completed before you begin your response, and we will
try to wait until your response is complete before we ask our next question.
The stenographer cannot record nonverbal responses such as shaking your head,
so it's important that you answer each question with an audible, verbal response.
see you shaking your head, don't worry about it, I'll just annotate it for the record, either
seeing a positive response or a negative response from the witness, that way the record is
We ask that you provide complete answers based on your best recollection.
the question is not clear, just ask one of us for a clarification.
the answer, please simply say so.
And if you do not know
You may only refuse to answer a question to preserve a privilege recognized by
the select committee, and such privileges including the Fifth Amendment privilege against
So I'm going to go through a few other points with you.
of these off the record just now, but I want to make sure that we go through these with
you on the record as well, Mr. Wright.
So, first, it's important that you understand that this interview is voluntary.
any time you would like to stop speaking with us, that is your choice.
Similarly, if at any point you need to discuss something with your attorney in
private, please let us know, and we'll take a break so you can have that conversation.
We will turn our cameras off, go on mute, you all can talk as long as you need to, and
then we'll come back on afterwards.
Also, this interview is not under oath, but because this is a formal select
committee investigation, you are obligated under Federal law to tell the truth, the same
as if you were speaking with the FBI or DOJ.
It is unlawful to deliberately provide false information to Congress.
interview, providing false information could result in criminal penalties for false
Third, you're not obligated to keep the fact of this interview and
us, including the prosecutor or judge on your case, or you can tell no one at all.
You are free to tell whomever you wish that you met with
So, fourth, the select committee, we're separate and independent
the DOJ is not a partner with the select committee and our investigation.
We have no involvement with the prosecutions, and
The select committee also is not a party to your criminal case and is not agreeing
to submit anything on your behalf to the judge.
So please let us know, as we move forward, if you need any
breaks or would like to discuss anything with your attorney.
There may be several people asking you questions here today.
virtually because you can see the box light up and we know when to stop talking, but if
you don't understand a question, please simply ask one of us to repeat it.
Because I've got an external mike I can get
and put right in front of him if that'd be easier.
I'm going to defer to the stenographer.
If at any point it becomes an issue, I can take a break
and it'd take me 5 minutes to get that from the other room and set it up.
So, Mr. Wright, let's just start with some background.
about yourself like where you're from, how long you've lived there, what's your
You say you've been in Canton you're entire life?
So how many times have you gone to the Hall of Fame?

I own a charter bus company.

I drove a concrete mixer for 10 years, and that's just about it.

didn't follow real close, I guess, until the pandemic.

then I started watching, you know, the internet and the news and -- you know, that's

have -- didn't have any of the other accounts.

you know, everybody's their own person.

uncomfortable -- or you kind of laughed just now -- what made you uncomfortable about
